name: v1.3.10
body:
Primary changes:

- #999, skip sorting in ArrayTagSet when adding SortedMap.
- #1000, avoid allocating extra space when overriding a tag.
- #1001, add jdk19 to CI.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v1.3.9...v1.3.10

name: v1.3.9
body:

- #997, update dependencies.
- #998, add support contains, starts, and ends.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v1.3.8...v1.3.9

name: v1.3.8
body:
Primary changes:

- #986, special case merging ArrayTagSet and TagList.
- #987, fix calculation of array size ArrayTagSet.addAll.
- #988, #989, #990, #991, overrides for spliterator to provide better performance.
- #992, add rate metric for survivor pool.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v1.3.7...v1.3.8

name: v1.3.7

body:

name: v1.3.1
body:

- #968, fix toString for repeated pattern.
- #969, add zero or one matcher.
- #970, support expanding OR clauses in regex.
- #971, fix removal of expressions with regex prefix.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v1.3.0...v1.3.1

name: v1.3.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #954, additional JVM metrics.
- #956, support polling monotonically increasing double value.
- #957, helper to run task using PolledMeter pool.
- #958, add registry that reports to SpectatorD.
- #960, improve indexing for `:in` clauses.
- #966, improve indexing for `:has` and `:re`.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v1.2.2...v1.3.0

body:

name: v0.135.0
body:

- #899, use HashSet implementation for In queries.
- #900, reduce overhead of cache compaction.
- #901, simplify repeat matcher toString output.
- #902, optimize case where regex always matches.
- #903, only parse expressions if needed.

name: v0.94.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #745, make sender pool size configurable.
- #748, avoid using streams for hot code paths.
- #749, add default implementations to `Id` interface to fix backwards compatibility issue introduced in 0.93.0.
- #750, reduce allocations for serializing measurements.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.93.0...v0.94.0

name: v0.93.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #711, agent now supports reloading configs from the file system if changed.
- #719, add helper to convert a Query to DNF.
- #723, add index for efficiently matching against a set of queries.
- #728, Atlas registry now supports multiple step sizes for LWC.
- #735, improve performance of looking up percentile distribution summary.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.92.0...v0.93.0

name: v0.92.2

name: v0.88.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #696, fix possible long overflow for AtlasTimer.
- #697, add counter for number of rejected tasks on ThreadPoolMonitor.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.87.0...v0.88.0

name: v0.87.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #692, update properties for compatibility with Spring Boot 2.
- #693, update default character set to match Frigga updates.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.86.0...v0.87.0

name: v0.86.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #496, IPC metrics integration for AWS SDK for Java V2.
- #690, reduce allocations for lookup of Percentile approximations.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.85.0...v0.86.0

name: v0.85.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #685, use `--release 8` when building on newer JDKs.
- #686, update IPC HTTP status code mapping for 503s to support historical Netflix behavior.
- #687, update slf4j to get fix for security vulnerability.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.84.0...v0.85.0

name: v0.84.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #675, add travis build for jdk12.
- #676, make PatternMatcher serializable.
- #677, raw metrics payload will be logged at trace level.
- #679, added limiter that rolls up dimensions that exceed a give size.
- #681, add reset() method for DefaultRegistry.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.83.0...v0.84.0

name: v0.83.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #663, updated build to use gradle 5.1.
- #670, support custom tags for AWS metrics collector.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.82.0...v0.83.0

name: v0.82.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #655, use four digits for decimal bucket names where needed.
- #656, compress payload sent to aggregators.
- #657, fix expiration of meters for StatelessRegistry.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.81.2...v0.82.0

name: v0.81.2

name: v0.81.0
body:

- #649, set endpoint to unknown if not specified.
- #650, do not put http status into detail.
- #651, helper for more efficient pattern matching.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.80.1...v0.81.0

name: v0.80.1

name: v0.80.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #632, AtlasRegistry will now ignore NaN values when publishing.
- #634, fix typo for `ipc.status.detail` tag key.
- #639, improve churn resistance for mostFrequent limiter.
- #640, registry implementation that delegates to Micrometer.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.79.0...v0.80.0

name: v0.79.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #627, AtlasRegistry can now be enabled and disabled at runtime.
- #628, mark ServoRegistry as deprecated. Servo is deprecated and this implementation is no longer used at Netflix.
- #631, update IPC metrics to use status and detail.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.78.0...v0.79.0

name: v0.78.0
body:

- #625, update eval payload to support diagnostic messages.
- #626, add `withTag(String, Enum)` for TagsBuilder.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.77.0...v0.78.0

name: v0.77.0
body:

- #624, use NetflixConfig for AtlasRegistry binding in `spectator-nflx-plugin`.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.76.0...v0.77.0

name: v0.76.0

- #610, fix lifecycle management for AtlasRegistry with SpectatorModule.
- #611, allow custom naming strategy to be used with Metrics3 registry.

- #605, use step clock for lwc eval payload.
- #606, exclude NaN values from the Spring web endpoint.

- #609, more detailed debug logging for polled gauges.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.74.4...v0.75.0

name: v0.69.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #544, `spectator-api` now only depends on `java.base` module.
- #553, fix resolution of lists for agent config.
- #561, added constants for Netflix headers used with IPC metrics.
- #562, avoid polling gauges inline with metrics collection.
- #570, JMX polling config now supports CompositeData values.
- #572, removed legacy config proxy in favor of lambda and default methods.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.68.0...v0.69.0

name: v0.68.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #552, fix loading of multiple configs for agent.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.67.0...v0.68.0

name: v0.67.0
body:

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.66.0...v0.67.0

name: v0.66.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #540, initial version of extension for common IPC metrics used at Netflix. Still experimental and may change.
- #541, helper method record `java.time.Duration` values to a timer.
- #547, allow counters to accept fractional updates.
- #548, registry now supports creating a max gauge.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.65.0...v0.66.0

body:

name: v0.65.0
body:

- #538, Atlas registry will ignore tag that uses reserved key `name`.

name: v0.63.0
body:

- #531, custom JMX gauges from agent now supported with `spectator-ext-jvm`.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.62.0...v0.63.0

name: v0.61.0
body:
Primary changes:

- #501, avoid using the same package name in multiple jars.
- #503, LongTaskTimer throws when used with NoopRegistry.
- #505, update Spark extension to work with 2.0 and 2.1.
- #507, fix illegal reflective access warning on jdk9.
- #509, make Scheduler more robust to uncaught throwables.
- #515, add Automatic-Module-Name to avoid future problems when used with JPMS.
- #518, update docs to reflect regression in jdk9 for monitoring GC behavior.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.60.0...v0.61.0

- #462, introduced PolledMeter to differentiate active and passive gauges.
- #463, added polled monitoring of common thread pool properties.

body:

body:

Primary changes:

body:

- #353, activity based gauges.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.44.0...v0.45.0

name: v0.44.0
body:
Primary changes:
- #346, add bitbucket JMX mapping for the agent.
- #348, reduce overhead of creating new percentile timers and distribution summaries.
- #349, update to nebula 3.5.2 to fix issues with JMH plugin.
- #350, web-spring will now add start time to metric response.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.43.0...v0.44.0

name: v0.43.0
body:
Primary changes:
- #340, reduce dependencies pulled in by spectator-web-spring library.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.42.0...v0.43.0

name: v0.42.0
body:
Primary changes:
- #321, remove deprecated dynamic id classes.
- #323, initial version of Atlas registry.
- #324, agent for simplifying collection of basic data from arbitrary jvm apps.

Atlas registry and agent are still experimental and intended for early adopters. This is an alternative to reporting into Atlas via the Servo registry with less baggage, but breaks a number of legacy use-cases from using Servo.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.41.0...v0.42.0

name: v0.42.0-rc.3
body: A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.42.0-rc.2...v0.42.0-rc.3

name: v0.42.0-rc.2
body: A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.42.0-rc.1...v0.42.0-rc.2

name: v0.42.0-rc.1
body: A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.41.0...v0.42.0-rc.1

name: v0.41.0
body:
Primary changes:
- #309, GC logger now uses powers of 1024 to match command line options to JDK.
- #316, Use compile scope in POM for dependencies exposed in public API.
- #317, Move placeholder ids to separate sub-project and deprecate.
- #318, Add spectator-web-spring sub-project for exposing data in the registry.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.40.0...v0.41.0

name: v0.40.0
body:
Primary changes:
- Update dependencies. In particular, aws-java-sdk updated from 1.10.x to 1.11.x. The 1.11.x release has at least one notable change causing compatibility issues, `AmazonCloudWatch.putMetricData` now has a return type of `PutMetricDataResult` instead of `void`.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.39.0...v0.40.0

name: v0.39.0
body:
Primary changes:
- Remove deprecated t-digest registry.
- Fix corrupt tag list when using string varargs method.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.38.1...v0.39.0

name: v0.38.1
body:
Primary changes:
- Fix ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when creating ids (#298).

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.38.0...v0.38.1

name: v0.38.0
body:
Primary changes:
- Fix image links and method name in timer docs.
- Improve performance of id creation.
- :warning: Remove deprecated `ValueFunction` and `ConfigMap`
  classes. The removal of `ValueFunction` and related `Registry.gauge`
  methods is not backwards compatible. They have been deprecated
  for some time and cause ongoing problems when using a lambda
  for registering a gauge (https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/issues/292).

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.37.0...v0.38.0

name: v0.37.0
body:
Primary changes:
- Documentation moved from wiki to using mkdocs hosted on [pages](http://netflix.github.io/spectator/en/latest/). This allows users to submit pull-requests for documentation updates and provides better search.
- Fix for 0 values being counted as negative in BucketTimer (#277).
- Fix detection of `serviceName` for AWS metric collector.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.36.0...v0.37.0

name: v0.36.0
body:
Primary changes:
- BucketFunctions now has helpers for quantities using metric (power of 1000) or binary (power of 1024) labels.
- Gauges are now supported when using the Metrics3 registry.
- DoubleDistributionSummary will now expire after a period of now activity.
- TDigest registry is now deprecated. Use PercentileTimer or PercentileDistributionSummary instead.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.35.1...v0.36.0

name: v0.35.1
body:
Primary changes:
- Gauges registered with TDigestRegistry will now get passed through to the underlying registry similar to counters.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.35.0...v0.35.1

name: v0.35.0
body:
Primary changes:
- Compatibility fix to ease transition away from ConfigMap.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.34.1...v0.35.0

name: v0.34.1
body:
Primary changes:
- Forcing a new release as there were some timeouts to bintray for 0.34.0. The
  artifacts for 0.34.0 appear to be ok, but just to be sure it is recommended to
  avoid it and use 0.34.1 instead. 
- Add prefix to distinguish timer and distribution summary percentile counters.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.34.0...v0.34.1

name: v0.34.0
body:
> :warning: There were some timeouts with the release build during the maven sync phase (https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/issues/261). Please use 0.34.1 instead.

Primary changes:
- Catch throwable in digest reporting thread to ensure logs are available to user.
- Added helpers for accessing registered meters as a [Stream](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/stream/Stream.html).
- Fix naming of SpectatorMetricCollector to match convention in aws sdk.
- Servo registry will not report timers and counters unless there is activity. Before it would report if the counter or timer was accessed even if there was no activity.
- Added bucket and percentile based timers and distribution summaries to api lib. Bucket variants in sandbox library now wrap these and are deprecated.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.33.0...v0.34.0

Primary changes:
- Improved toString and equals for ids created using ServoRegistry.
- Initial support for dynamic ids.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.32.0...v0.33.0

Primary changes:
- Upgrade to nebula 3.1.2 to verify it fixes the maven sync issue.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.31.0...v0.32.0

Primary changes:
- Total of squares value was being reported incorrectly leading to confusing std deviation values.
- Added module to make it easier to [unit test](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/wiki/TDigest#testing) with TDigestRegistry.
- Added metric collector library, `spectator-ext-aws`, for the AWS SDK. This is an initial version and we may still change some of the reported metrics.
- Cleanup:
  - Refactored ids behavior to be [more intuitive](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/pull/220).
  - Removed metrics2 registry.
  - Removed chronos listener for capturing GC events in the Netflix plugin.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.30.0...v0.31.0

Primary changes:

Update generic types for Registry.gauge methods so a cast isn't needed:

``` java
Queue<Item> queue = ...

// This will now work:
registry.gauge("gauge", queue, Queue::size)

// Instead of:
registry.gauge("gauge", queue, q -> ((Queue) q).size())
```

Adds configuration block to allow for common tags to be added to reported digests:

```
spectator.tdigest.tags = [
  {
    key = "app"
    value = ${APP_NAME}
  }
]
```

Others:
- Fixes name mapping for metrics3 registry so tags are separated with a `.`.
- Added additional compatibility test case using class compiled with a previous version. Catches a number of binary compatibility issues missed with the existing checkCompatibility task.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.29.0...v0.30.0

Primary changes:
- Set governator version to 1.7.6-rc.1. Avoids problem with `AutoBindSingleton` and classpath scanning.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.29.0...v0.29.1

Primary changes:
- Use travis for snapshot and release builds.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.28.0...v0.29.0

Primary changes:
- Compile for java 8, java 7 is no longer supported.
- Rollup behavior changed to use the most recently added value.
- Fix value for memtype tag on jvm memory metrics.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.27.0...v0.28.0

Primary changes:
- Remove dependency on archaius2 since there is not a stable release yet.
- Allow spark gauges that have a monotonically increasing value to get mapped to a counter.
- Fix bug causing invalid json to get generated for some messages to the sidecar.
- Get spark tagging information from the environment.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.26.0...v0.27.0

Primary changes:
- Updates to guice 4 release.
- Ensure the static initialization of `Spectator` class is not invoked during configure method of the module.
- Use daemon thread for sidecar registry.
- Fix bug with context class loader being null when running with spark.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.25.0...v0.26.0

Primary changes:
- Fix bug with automatic bucket labels using the wrong unit causing several buckets to receive the same label.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.24.0...v0.25.0

Primary changes:
- Spectator module for the Netflix plugin install rxnetty module to avoid binding errors.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.23.0...v0.24.0

Primary changes:
- Make mapping for spark sink configurable.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.22.0...v0.23.0

Primary changes:
- Switches to newer version of the http client with rxjava unshadowed.
- Start experimenting with archaius2 for T-Digest registry.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.21.0...v0.22.0

Primary changes:
- Fix injection errors when relying on `@AutoBindSingleton` plugin. 
- Initial version of registry to report timers and distribution summaries as a T-Digest.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.20.0...v0.21.0

Primary changes:
- Update to rxnetty 0.4.6, fixes metrics issue with client names in previous versions.
- Fix refresh of server list when using eureka.
- Added helper function for registering log4j2 appender after logging system has been configured (see https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/pull/116).
- Switch to new nebula based build.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/v0.19.0...v0.20.0

Primary changes:
- Fix race condition where gauge values could get collected before getting read by the servo observer.
- Updates to rxnetty helper. The DiscoveryClient is now injected and connection pooling is enabled.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.18...v0.19.0

Primary changes:
- Set client name when building RxNetty client. This is to avoid getting a huge number of metrics with the default naming scheme used by RxNetty. 

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.17...0.18

Primary changes:
- Add helper for bucket counters, timers, and distribution summaries to the sandbox.
- Change log level for GC events to debug to reduce noise for users that don't want it by default.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.16...0.17

Note, 0.15 skipped due to some build snafus. This release does an initial attempt at better integration with other Netflix libraries.

Primary changes:
- Guice module for Netflix plugin, see updated [integration docs](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/wiki/Netflix-Integration).
- Pin dependencies to explicit versions rather than using `latest.release`.
- Switch from `ribbon-httpclient` to shaded version of `rxnetty`.
- Configuration settings with bindings to `archaius`.
- Activity based meters will now expire after a period of no use when using the servo registry.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.14...0.16

Primary changes:
- Guice module for Netflix plugin, see updated [integration docs](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/wiki/Netflix-Integration).

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.14.1...0.14.2

Primary changes:
- Pin dependencies to explicit versions rather than using `latest.release`.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.14...0.14.1

Primary changes:
- Change servo registry to use StepCounter instead of BasicCounter ([details](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/pull/42)).
- Add helper for getting a registered instance of a DoubleDistributionSummary.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.13...0.14

Primary changes:
- JVM stats for buffers and pools.
- Turn off doclint to allow build to work with java 8 (longer term [#27](https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/issues/27)).
- Switch from deprecated calls in ribbon-httpclient to ribbon-transport.
- Added experimental sandbox library for trying things before they are considered stable. Initial experiment is a distribution summary type that takes doubles instead of long.
- Split Netflix integration library to allow it to be used without forcing AutoBindSingleton.
- Fix overflow with `totalOfSquares` on timers.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.12...0.13

Primary changes:
- Updated the statistics for timers when using the servo registry to include `totalTimeSquared`. Precomputing this gives us a convenient way to determine standard deviation across groups on backends that allow aggregation.
- Remove listener methods from Registry interface. For most of the interesting use-cases it was insufficient and a dedicated Registry implementation can do a better job of generating a meaningful stream of events.

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.11...0.12

Primary changes:
- Multiple registries can be used at the same time. Default behavior is all registries in the classpath will be loaded and used.
- Fixes several issues with reporting of GC events:
  - Issue #2, the live data size will now get updated any time there is a reduction in the old gen heap size as well as after a major GC.
  - End time reported to chronos was off by the uptime of the jvm.  

A comprehensive list of changes can be found in the commit log: https://github.com/Netflix/spectator/compare/0.10...0.11
This and all previous releases were created to test getting the jenkins release build process working.
